title: View AFL flows in OO Workflow Designer
content:
Operations Orchestration (OO) Workflow Designer displays a read-only view of AFL flows authored in OO Studio. In OO Workflow Designer, you can view a graphical representation of AFL flows in the GRAPH tab. You can view flow level Inputs, Outputs, Scriptlet, and other flow properties in the PROPERTIES tab.

Note: Debugging for AFL flows isn't yet supported.

View AFL flows

To view AFL flows in OO Workflow Designer, in the Dependencies pane, navigate to the folder containing the flow, and double-click the flow. The selected flow displays in the authoring pane in read-only mode. 

The Dependencies pane now displays an icon-based differentiation between AFL Content Packs and CloudSlang Content Packs.

UI elements Description
Blue folder icon represents the AFL flow.
Green folder icon represents the CloudSlang (CS) flow.

To view step information of a step in the canvas, see View step details in AFL flows.

View flow graphical representation

To view the graphical representation of the selected flow, click the GRAPH tab.

By default, the selected flow displays in the GRAPH tab in read-only mode.

The graphical representation comes with new icons and color schemes when compared with the graphical representation of the flow in Desktop Studio.

Any discrepancies in AFL flow representation, compared with Desktop Studio that might occur to both steps, transitions, or callouts, are due to the slight alignment of the AFL flow to the Workflow Designer look and feel. (For example, as both the width and height of the steps in Designer are greater than the ones from Studio the transitions between steps will look shorter, thus steps closer to each other).

Studio Designer

All step icons have a new look and feel. Annotations however aren't supported thus any step with an annotation definition in Desktop Studio is missing such representation in Workflow Designer.

Steps that are actual flows are described in the Canvas with an icon similar to . Steps missing such representation are actual operations.

Non-blocking steps are identifiable through an icon similar to .

Transitions of the Manual operation are no longer depicted in blue (diagnosed) but in green (success).

Studio Designer

No step error representation is displayed yet for a step in an AFL flow. However, any AFL flow that's not valid due to a missing dependency is represented as such in the dependencies tree view (highlighted in red). The available errors are described at the flow tab level after opening the AFL flow.

There is also no specific representation for a step with a missing dependency as in Desktop Studio. Thus, no dotted transitions, grayed-out transition names, or missing icon representation in the Designer canvas will occur. However, steps with missing dependencies might be represented with a generic icon and might have all the responses colored in green (as if successful) even when they shouldn't.

See below an example of a missing dependencies representation of a flow in Desktop Studio versus Workflow Designer:

Studio Designer

Drilldown from the toolbar or the context menu is supported (similar to Open Subflow or Open Operation from the Desktop Studio context menu).

You can zoom in and out on Canvas or Go to Source.

View flow properties

To view the properties of the selected flow, click the PROPERTIES tab. 

The PROPERTIES tab displays the flow's properties. It includes:

Tab Description
Inputs Displays the flow inputs. Selecting a step input will populate the Inputs details panel on the right.
Outputs Displays the flow output. Displays the flow outputs as step outputs when you use the flow as a step.
Responses Displays the responses dragged to the canvas for the flow.
Description Shows a summary of what the flow does.
Scriptlet Displays the formatted JavaScript code added for the selected flow.
